intro: Hippocratea bilobicarpa, commonly known as the two-lobed hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
